poem:
Title: "Promises at the Pledges' Pyre"

Words flew stark over patchwork green,
'Can't turn taps to fix,' they mean.
At election hearth, Labour stands
Unraveling promises from its hands.
Rayner's voice – a silver thread,
Echoes over a council's bed.
Chimes in ears, 'Nothing wrong,' she purred,
After she'd sold what once she had secured.

Angela Rayner has said she did “absolutely nothing wrong” when she sold her council house after". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
